title: Ticket #1140: Run old ClassAds tests on compatibility layer
description:
Compile and run the old ClassAds test suite using the new ClassAds compatibility layer. Fix any test failures.

Milestones

  • Compile test program, fixing unsupported features [DONE]
  • Run test program and fix any failures [DONE]
  • Change the Condor test suite to call the new version of the ClassAds test [DONE]
remarks:
After fixing a bug that crashed the test program, the initial run has 197 of 282 tests passing.

2010-Jan-27 09:24:24 by jfrey:
All tests now pass (211 of 211). The other tests have been disabled because they test features not supported in new ClassAds.

2010-Jan-27 09:25:50 by jfrey:
These old ClassAds tests uncovered a few bugs in the compatibility layer and some bugs in new ClassAds themselves.
check_ins:
2010-Jan-27 11:58   Check-in [16993]: Add old ClassAd test program to test suite for compat layer. #1140 (By Jaime Frey )
2010-Jan-27 09:22   Check-in [16991]: Fix erroneous evaluation errors in some ClassAds functions. #1140 A few ClassAd functions would return an evaluation error if the wrong number or type of arguments was given to them. Evaluation should succeed in these cases, with a resulting value of Error. (By Jaime Frey )
2010-Jan-27 09:19   Check-in [16990]: Fix bug in ifThenElse() new ClassAd function #1140 If the first argument of ifThenElse() evaluated to a real, the code tried (and failed) to treat it as an integer, resulting in an evaluation error. (By Jaime Frey )
2010-Jan-27 09:16   Check-in [16989]: Allow random() ClassAd function to take 0 arguments. #1140 According to the documentation, the one argument to the random function is optional. If it's omitted, a default value of 1.0 is to be used. The code made the argument mandatory. (By Jaime Frey )
2010-Jan-27 09:14   Check-in [16988]: Fix bug with negative length argument to strsub() function. #1140 When passing a negative length to the substr() new ClassAds function, if the magnitude of the value is greater than the number of available characters following the starting point of the substring, reset the length to 0. This results in [...] (By Jaime Frey )
2010-Jan-27 09:04   Check-in [16986]: Fix or remove some old ClassAd tests for the compat layer. #1140 * Use commas to separate function arguments. * formattime() can take a negative first argument. * Passing an undefined value to substr() results in an Undefined value on return, not an Error. * Operands to && and || must be booleans. * [...] (By Jaime Frey )
2010-Jan-26 17:30   Check-in [16981]: Fix up old ClassAds tests for compat layer. #1140 * size(undefined) returns undefined in new ClassAds. * stringlist functions aren't supported in new ClassAds. * 't' and 'f' aren't synonyms for 'true' and 'false' (By Jaime Frey )
2010-Jan-26 14:56   Check-in [16979]: Fix dirty attribute tests for compat ClassAds. #1140 Change ResetName() to ResetExpr(). (By Jaime Frey )
2010-Jan-26 14:23   Check-in [16978]: Fix ad syntax in GetReferences() tests for ClassAd compat layer. #1140 * Function call arguments are separated with a comma now, not a semicolon. * MY. scoping only works when using a MatchClassAd. (By Jaime Frey )
2010-Jan-26 14:18   Check-in [16977]: Fix bug in new ClassAd::GetInternalReferences(). #1140 In some cases, recursing through the expression tree would erroneously end early when an external reference was encountered. (By Jaime Frey )
2010-Jan-26 13:16   Check-in [16976]: Fix unparsing tests for compat ClassAds. #1140 * White-space and capitalization are slightly different with new ClassAds. * 't' and 'f' aren't synonyms for 'true' and 'false' in new ClassAds. This "feature" of old ClassAds will not be emulated. (By Jaime Frey )
2010-Jan-26 10:56   Check-in [16970]: ClassAd::GetMy/TargetTypeName() should never return NULL. #1140 The new ClassAds compatibility layer was mistakenly returning NULL when the attribute wasn't set. (By Jaime Frey )
2010-Jan-26 10:53   Check-in [16969]: Test compat layer with old ClassAds test program. #1140 This is a version of src/classad.old/test_classads.cpp, modified to work with the new ClassAds compatibility layer. Some features of old ClassAds are not supported in the commpatibility layer (ones not used by Condor). (By Jaime Frey )
creator: jfrey
